html: The “day of reckoning”—Jehovah’s Day of Judgment—hastens on even as the lawmakers of Jehovah’s people act as if no such thing will occur (vv 1-2 ). Their ill-gotten wealth won’t save them in that day, nor will others extend help (Isaiah 47:11 ). Jehovah will remove his righteous people from their midst, leaving them to suffer his judgments alone (Isaiah 57:1 ). The “holocaust” (so’a ) from afar refers to Jehovah’s destruction by fire and by the sword that arrives from afar, from beyond the horizon, to desolate the earth (v 23; Isaiah 5:23-26; 13:4-19; 28:22; 30:27-28; 33:11-12; 34:2-8; 66:15-16 ).
